title: Conductors - charged spheres of different sizes

content.question: A metal sphere with radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is given an initial charge of <math alttext="uppercase Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. A second, smaller and neutral, metal sphere with radius <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, such that <math alttext="uppercase R is equal to a times lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>r</mi></math>, where <math alttext="a is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></math>, is placed far away from the first sphere. A wire connects the two spheres, as shown, until equilibrium is reached. The charge on the smaller sphere is then <math alttext="lowercase q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math>. Which of the following represents the fraction <math alttext="the fraction lowercase q over uppercase Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction a over a plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 1 over a plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over a plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>
